sect1.title: ESAI_00000
sect1.para: ESAI_00000 The ESAI driver shall conform to the ASoC architecture

sect1.title: ESAI_00005
sect1.para: ESAI_00005 The ESAI driver shall support suspend/resume

sect1.title: ESAI_00006
sect1.para: ESAI_00006 The ESAI driver shall disable its regulators when idle/inactive.

sect1.title: ESAI_00010
sect1.para: ESAI_00010 The ESAI driver shall support record.

sect1.title: ESAI_00015
sect1.para: ESAI_00015 The ESAI driver shall use double buffered DMA to transfer data.

sect1.title: ESAI_00020
sect1.para: ESAI_00020 The ESAI driver shall minimize power consumption by using clock gating and disabling audio related hardware that is not actively being used.

sect1.title: ESAI_00025
sect1.para: ESAI_00025 To reduce power during audio playback, there must be support for audio buffers to be placed in external memory or internal memory.

sect1.title: ESAI_00030
sect1.para: ESAI_00030 The ESAI driver shall support multi-channel PCM wave data playback function.

sect1.title: ESAI_00035
sect1.para: ESAI_00035 The ESAI driver shall support multi-channel PCM wave data record function.

sect1.title: ESAI_00040
sect1.para: ESAI_00040 The ESAI driver shall support 16bit and 24 bit PCM data. (the 24bit PCM data is packed in 32 bit with bit23~bit0 effect)

sect1.title: ESAI_00060
sect1.para: ESAI_00060 The ESAI driver shall support playback the following sample rates without ASRC support at : 32K, 44.1K, 48K, 88.2K, 96K

sect1.title: ESAI_00065
sect1.para: ESAI_00065 The ESAI driver shall support playback the following sample rates with ASRC support from 32K~96K( 16 bit PCM data is not supported by ASRC)

sect1.title: ESAI_00070
sect1.para: ESAI_00070 The ESAI driver shall support recording

sect1.title: ESAI_00075
sect1.para: ESAI_00075 The ESAI driver shall support record the following sample rates: 48K, 44.1K, 32K,24K,16K,12K,8K

sect1.title: ESAI_00080
sect1.para: ESAI_00080 The ESAI driver shall be configurable as a built-in driver.

sect1.title: ESAI_00085
sect1.para: ESAI_00085 The ESAI driver shall be configurable as loadable module

sect1.title: ESAI_00090
sect1.para: ESAI_00090 The ESAI driver shall allow to use the 8 channel codec as two independent output audio streams, of respectively 6 and 2 channels. The sample rate is common.

sect1.title: ESAI_00096
sect1.para: ESAI_00096 The ESAI driver shall support record from 4 input channels, split in two independent groups of 2 channels

sect1.title: ESAI_00100
sect1.para: ESAI_00100 The ESAI driver shall support full duplex operations without any restrictions

sect1.title: ESAI_00110
sect1.para: ESAI_00110 The audio volume of each device of each soundcard shall be controllable from user space (amixer/alsamixer)

formalpara.para: TGE-LV-BTL-MFG-0010: UTP_UPDATE: Use MFG tool to flash bootloader, kernel and rootfs

sect1.title: MAN_00060
sect1.para: MAN_00060 The update application of TMT shall support downloading a new boot stream and RFS from the HMT and programming them into both the primary and secondary boot/RFS locations

formalpara.title: TGE-LV-BTL-MFG-0010
formalpara.para: TGE-LV-BTL-MFG-0010: UTP_UPDATE: Use MFG tool to flash bootloader, kernel and rootfs

sect1.title: MAN_00065
sect1.para: MAN_00065 The update application of TMT shall support downloading pre-load content drive through the HMT protocol and storing it on a specified data

formalpara.title: TGE-LV-BTL-MFG-0010
formalpara.para: TGE-LV-BTL-MFG-0010: UTP_UPDATE: Use MFG tool to flash bootloader, kernel and rootfs

sect1.title: MAN_00070
sect1.para: MAN_00070 The update application of TMT shall support blowing any on-chip fuse

formalpara.title: TGE-LV-BTL-MFG-0010
formalpara.para: TGE-LV-BTL-MFG-0010: UTP_UPDATE: Use MFG tool to flash bootloader, kernel and rootfs

sect1.title: ISU_00000
sect1.para: ISU_00000 The ISU process shall be initiated by the user

sect1.title: ISU_00005
sect1.para: ISU_00005 The ISU process shall run in user space

sect1.title: ISU_00010
sect1.para: ISU_00010 The ISU shall update the secondary root file system and boot stream first (before updating the primary RFS and boot stream), the system running off of the primary stream/RFS

sect1.title: ISU_00015
sect1.para: ISU_00015 The ISU shall be able to read the update material (boot stream and root file system) from SD/MMC/USB

sect1.title: ISU_00016
sect1.para: ISU_00016 The ISU shall be able to read the update material (boot stream and root file system) from NAND

sect1.title: ISU_00020
sect1.para: ISU_00020 The ISU shall check that the updated secondary boot stream and RFS are good by decrypting the encrypted parts before writing them to the storage medium and by booting the system off of the secondary material (stream/RFS)

sect1.title: ISU_00025
sect1.para: ISU_00025 The ISU shall run up to 5 attempts to update the secondary boot stream and root file system. Afterwards, the secondary boot stream and root file system will be reverted to the primary boot stream and RFS respectively

sect1.title: ISU_00030
sect1.para: ISU_00030 The ISU shall update the primary boot stream and root file system by running off of the secondary boot stream and root file system

sect1.title: ISU_00035
sect1.para: ISU_00035 The ISU shall notify the user of the success or failure of the update process.

sect1.title: ISU_00040
sect1.para: ISU_00040 If the update of the primary stream/RFS fails (decryption issue), an error shall be reported. If the update fails because of a loss of power, the update of the primary stream/RFS shall restart.

sect1.title: ISU_00045
sect1.para: ISU_00045 The ISU shall test the boot streams (decrypt) before update.

sect1.title: RED_00000
sect1.para: RED_00000 Two identical boot streams shall be maintained on the device to provide a redundant boot path.

sect1.title: RED_00005
sect1.para: RED_00005 Two identical root file systems shall be maintained on the device to provide a redundant boot path.

sect1.title: RED_00010
sect1.para: RED_00010 The system shall by default boot off of the primary boot stream

sect1.title: RED_00015
sect1.para: RED_00015 The system shall boot out of the secondary boot stream if the system fails to boot out of the primary boot stream

sect1.title: RED_00020
sect1.para: RED_00020 The tool chain shall include the boot image encryption tool in its normal build flow

sect1.title: RED_00025
sect1.para: RED_00025 The selected kernel should use the associated root file system (i.e. primary image uses primary root file system)

sect1.title: RED_00030
sect1.para: RED_00030 When a corrupted boot stream is detected, the booted kernel shall have the ability (configurable) to repair the boot image from the other image

sect1.title: GEN_00015
sect1.para: GEN_00015 The Linux kernel 2.6.31 or later shall be ported to i.MX

sect1.title: GEN_00020
sect1.para: GEN_00020 The Linux kernel 2.6.35 or later shall be ported to i.MX

sect1.title: GEN_00025
sect1.para: GEN_00025 Each device driver shall support all the fuse configurations implemented in the hardware IP it supports

sect1.title: APP_00005
sect1.para: APP_00005 Gstreamer shall be delivered
